The Rose family.

 Petals: 5

 Sepals: 5

 Stamens: many

 Styles: many

 Info: sepals alternate with petals.

The Pink family.

 2 to 5 styles.

 5 OR 10 stamens.

 5 petals, the ends are often split.

 5 sepals.

 Superior ovary.

The Buckwheat/Knotweed family.
Plants typically have many small flowers.

 No petals.
 5-6 coloured sepals. 3 to 9 stamens.
 3 styles.

The Carrot/Parsley family.

 Flowers arranged in compound umbels.
 5 petals.
 5 stamens.

The Lily family.

 3 petals and 3 sepals, often the same size and colour.
 6 stamens.
 Pistil with a 3-parted stigma.
 Leaves with parallel veins.
